summary.span: Provides static methods for the creation, copying, deletion, moving, and opening of a single file, and aids in the creation of objects.

span.span: Provides static methods for the creation, copying, deletion, moving, and opening of a single file, and aids in the creation of objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用类的典型操作，如复制、 移动、 重命名、 创建、 打开、 删除，以及每次将追加到单个文件。Use the class for typical operations such as copying, moving, renaming, creating, opening, deleting, and appending to a single file at a time. 此外可以使用类来获取和设置文件属性或信息与创建、 访问和文件的写入。You can also use the class to get and set file attributes or information related to the creation, access, and writing of a file. 如果你想要对多个文件执行操作，请参阅或。If you want to perform operations on multiple files, see or . 许多方法返回其他 I/O 类型，创建或打开文件时。Many of the methods return other I/O types when you create or open files. 您可以使用这些其他类型以进一步处理文件。You can use these other types to further manipulate a file. 有关详细信息，请参阅特定成员，如， ，或。For more information, see specific members such as , , or . 因为所有方法是静态的可能会使用更高效方法，而不是相应实例方法，如果你想要执行多项操作。Because all methods are static, it might be more efficient to use a method rather than a corresponding instance method if you want to perform only one action. 所有方法需要进行操作的文件的路径。All methods require the path to the file that you are manipulating. 静态方法类执行的所有方法的安全检查。The static methods of the class perform security checks on all methods. 如果要多次重用对象，请考虑使用相应的实例方法的相反，因为安全检查将不总是有必要。If you are going to reuse an object several times, consider using the corresponding instance method of instead, because the security check will not always be necessary. 默认情况下，对新文件的完全读/写访问权限授予所有用户。By default, full read/write access to new files is granted to all users. 下表描述了用于自定义的各种行为的枚举方法。The following table describes the enumerations that are used to customize the behavior of various methods. |枚举Enumeration|描述Description| |-----------------|-----------------| ||指定读取和写入访问的文件。Specifies read and write access to a file.| ||指定的文件，已在使用允许的访问级别。Specifies the level of access permitted for a file that is already in use.| ||指定现有文件的内容是保留还是覆盖，以及请求创建的现有文件是否会导致异常。Specifies whether the contents of an existing file are preserved or overwritten, and whether requests to create an existing file cause an exception.| > [!NOTE] > 在接受路径作为输入字符串的成员，该路径必须是格式正确，或引发的异常。In members that accept a path as an input string, that path must be well-formed or an exception is raised. 例如，如果路径是完全限定名称，但以空格开头，在类的方法不修整路径。For example, if a path is fully qualified but begins with a space, the path is not trimmed in methods of the class. 因此，该路径的格式不正确，并且会引发的异常。Therefore, the path is malformed and an exception is raised. 同样的路径的组合不能完全限定两次。Similarly, a path or a combination of paths cannot be fully qualified twice. 例如，"c:\temp c:\windows"还会引发异常在大多数情况下。For example, "c:\temp c:\windows" also raises an exception in most cases. 请确保使用接受一个路径字符串的方法时您的路径的格式是否正确。Ensure that your paths are well-formed when using methods that accept a path string. 在接受一个路径的成员，路径可以引用的文件或只是一个目录。In members that accept a path, the path can refer to a file or just a directory. 指定的路径也可以指相对路径或服务器和共享名称的通用命名约定 (UNC) 路径。The specified path can also refer to a relative path or a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path for a server and share name. 例如，以下所有条件都可接受的路径：For example, all the following are acceptable paths: - `"c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt"` 在C#，或`"c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt"`在 Visual Basic 中。`"c:\\\MyDir\\\MyFile.txt"` in C#, or `"c:\MyDir\MyFile.txt"` in Visual Basic. - `"c:\\\MyDir"` 在C#，或`"c:\MyDir"`在 Visual Basic 中。`"c:\\\MyDir"` in C#, or `"c:\MyDir"` in Visual Basic. - `"MyDir\\\MySubdir"` 在C#，或`"MyDir\MySubDir"`在 Visual Basic 中。`"MyDir\\\MySubdir"` in C#, or `"MyDir\MySubDir"` in Visual Basic. - `"\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare"` 在C#，或`"\\\MyServer\MyShare"`在 Visual Basic 中。`"\\\\\\\MyServer\\\MyShare"` in C#, or `"\\\MyServer\MyShare"` in Visual Basic. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用类，以检查是否存在文件，并根据结果，或者创建一个新文件并向其中写入，或打开现有文件并从中读取。The following example demonstrates how to use the class to check whether a file exists, and depending on the result, either create a new file and write to it, or open the existing file and read from it. 运行代码之前，创建`c:\temp`文件夹。Before running the code, create a `c:\temp` folder. [!code-cpp[File Class Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/File Class Example/CPP/file class example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[File Class Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/File Class Example/CS/file class example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[File Class Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/File Class Example/VB/file class example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 给定一个字符串和文件路径，此方法打开指定的文件，将字符串追加到文件末尾，然后关闭该文件。Given a string and a file path, this method opens the specified file, appends the string to the end of the file, and then closes the file. 文件句柄保证要关闭此方法，即使引发异常。The file handle is guaranteed to be closed by this method, even if exceptions are raised. 如果不存在，但不会创建新目录，该方法将创建该文件。The method creates the file if it doesn't exist, but it doesn't create new directories. 因此，值`path`参数必须包含现有目录。Therefore, the value of the `path` parameter must contain existing directories. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法将额外的文本添加到文件末尾。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to add extra text to the end of a file. 在此示例中，如果它尚不存在，并且文本添加到它创建一个文件。In this example, a file is created if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. 但是，目录名`temp`C 必须成功完成该示例的驱动器上。However, the directory named `temp` on drive C must exist for the example to complete successfully. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法等效于构造函数重载。This method is equivalent to the constructor overload. 如果指定的文件`path`不存在，则创建它。If the file specified by `path` does not exist, it is created. 如果文件确实存在，写入到操作将文本追加到该文件。If the file does exist, write operations to the append text to the file. 允许其他线程读取该文件打开时。Additional threads are permitted to read the file while it is open. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . `path`参数不区分大小写。The `path` parameter is not case-sensitive. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例将文本追加到文件。The following example appends text to a file. 如果文件不存在，该方法将创建一个新文件。The method creates a new file if the file doesn't exist. 但是，目录名`temp`C 必须成功完成该示例的驱动器上。However, the directory named `temp` on drive C must exist for the example to complete successfully. remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过此方法创建的对象具有一个默认的值; 任何其他进程或代码可以访问的创建的文件，直到关闭原始文件句柄。The object created by this method has a default value of ; no other process or code can access the created file until the original file handle is closed. 此方法等效于方法重载使用默认的缓冲区大小为 4,096 字节。This method is equivalent to the method overload using the default buffer size of 4,096 bytes. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果指定的文件不存在，则创建它;如果它存在并且不是只读的内容将被覆盖。If the specified file does not exist, it is created; if it does exist and it is not read-only, the contents are overwritten. 默认情况下，对新文件的完全读/写访问权限授予所有用户。By default, full read/write access to new files is granted to all users. 文件打开了具有读/写访问权限，并且它可由其他应用程序中打开之前，必须关闭。The file is opened with read/write access and must be closed before it can be opened by another application. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例中指定的路径创建一个文件，将一些信息写入到该文件，从文件中读取。The following example creates a file in the specified path, writes some information to the file, and reads from the file. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法，可解密使用加密文件方法。The method allows you to decrypt a file that was encrypted using the method. 方法可以解密使用当前用户帐户已加密的文件。The method can decrypt only files that were encrypted using the current user account. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此 API 仅支持 Windows 平台上，可以使用 NTFS 加密文件系统 (EFS)。This API is only supported on Windows platforms that are able to use the NTFS Encrypting File System (EFS). 如果尝试在非 Windows 系统、 Windows Home Edition 系统或非 NTFS 驱动器结果中的使用这或，具体视情况而定。Any attempt to use this on non-Windows systems, Windows Home Edition systems, or non-NTFS drives results in a or , depending on the situation. > > 不建议使用此 API 在.NET Core 中;它为了启用的应用程序迁移到.NET Core 但仍显式面向 Windows 的可移植性。Use of this API in .NET Core is not recommended; it is included to enable portability for applications that move to .NET Core but still explicitly target Windows. 方法要求独占访问正在解密该文件，并将另一个进程正在使用该文件的情况下引发的异常。The method requires exclusive access to the file being decrypted, and will raise an exception if another process is using the file. 如果未加密文件，将返回非零值，该值指示成功。If the file is not encrypted, will return a nonzero value, which indicates success. 这两个方法和方法使用安装在计算机和调用方法的过程的文件加密密钥的加密服务提供程序 (CSP)。Both the method and the method use the cryptographic service provider (CSP) installed on the computer and the file encryption keys of the process calling the method. 当前文件系统必须格式化为 NTFS 和当前操作系统必须是 Windows NT 或更高版本。The current file system must be formatted as NTFS and the current operating system must be Windows NT or later. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法和方法来加密和解密文件。The following code example uses the method and the method to encrypt and then decrypt a file. 文件必须存在为示例正常运行。The file must exist for the example to work. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法不应使用的路径验证时，此方法只是检查在指定的文件是否`path`存在。The method should not be used for path validation, this method merely checks if the file specified in `path` exists. 传递到无效的路径返回`false`。Passing an invalid path to returns `false`. 若要检查路径是否包含任何无效字符，可以调用方法来检索文件系统对无效的字符。To check whether the path contains any invalid characters, you can call the method to retrieve the characters that are invalid for the file system. 此外可以创建正则表达式来测试是否为您的环境的路径无效。You can also create a regular expression to test the whether the path is valid for your environment. 有关可接受的路径的示例，请参阅。For examples of acceptable paths, see . 若要检查目录是否存在，请参阅。To check if a directory exists, see . 请注意，另一个进程可以可能进行一些处理调用的时间之间的文件方法并执行该文件，另一个操作，如。Be aware that another process can potentially do something with the file in between the time you call the method and perform another operation on the file, such as . `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果`path`描述一个目录，此方法返回`false`。If `path` describes a directory, this method returns `false`. 尾随空格都将从中`path`之前确定是否存在该文件的参数。Trailing spaces are removed from the `path` parameter before determining if the file exists. 方法将返回`false`如果尝试确定是否存在指定的文件时出现任何错误。The method returns `false` if any error occurs while trying to determine if the specified file exists. 这可以在引发异常，例如传递文件名包含无效的字符或字符太多，失败或丢失的磁盘的情况下会发生或如果调用方不具有读取该文件的权限。This can occur in situations that raise exceptions such as passing a file name with invalid characters or too many characters, a failing or missing disk, or if the caller does not have permission to read the file. ## Examples 下面的示例确定文件是否存在。The following example determines if a file exists. ACL 描述个人和/或组具有或没有执行到对给定文件的特定操作的权限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或删除访问控制列表条目](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md). 在 NTFS 环境中，并如果用户具有向用户授予上的父文件夹的权限。In NTFS environments, and are granted to the user if the user has rights on the parent folder. 若要拒绝并，拒绝上的父目录。To deny and , deny on the parent directory. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用和方法来添加，然后删除所需的访问控制列表 (ACL) 项从一个文件。The following code example uses the and the methods to add and then remove an access control list (ACL) entry from a file. 你必须提供有效的用户或组帐户以运行此示例。You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 此方法可能返回不准确的值，因为它使用其值可能不会持续更新由操作系统的本机函数。This method may return an inaccurate value, because it uses native functions whose values may not be continuously updated by the operating system. `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果该文件中所述`path`参数不存在，此方法将返回到公元 1601 年 1 月 1 日午夜 12:00 点If the file described in the `path` parameter does not exist, this method returns 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.)协调世界时 (UTC)，调整为本地时间。(C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time. NTFS 格式的驱动器可能会缓存一个文件，例如短时间内的文件创建时间有关的信息。NTFS-formatted drives may cache information about a file, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. 因此，可能需要显式设置文件的创建时间，如果要覆盖或替换现有文件。As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示`GetCreationTime`。The following example demonstrates `GetCreationTime`. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 此方法可能返回不准确的值，因为它使用其值可能不会持续更新由操作系统的本机函数。This method may return an inaccurate value, because it uses native functions whose values may not be continuously updated by the operating system. 每个操作系统管理根据其自己的规则的上次编写时间。Each operating system manages the last write time according to its own rules. 为了提高性能，操作系统未设置上次写入时间值的最后一个写入操作的确切时间，但可能会将其设置为接近的近似相反。To improve performance, an operating system might not set the last write time value to the exact time of the last write operation, but might set it to a close approximation instead. 如果该文件中所述`path`参数不存在，此方法将返回到公元 1601 年 1 月 1 日午夜 12:00 点If the file described in the `path` parameter does not exist, this method returns 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.)协调世界时 (UTC)。(C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). `path`参数允许指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法跨磁盘卷，它不会引发异常，如果源和目标相同。This method works across disk volumes, and it does not throw an exception if the source and destination are the same. 请注意，如果你尝试通过将具有相同名称的文件移动到该目录来替换的文件，您。Note that if you attempt to replace a file by moving a file of the same name into that directory, you get an . Move 方法不能用于覆盖现有文件。You cannot use the Move method to overwrite an existing file. `sourceFileName`和`destFileName`参数可以包括相对或绝对路径信息。The `sourceFileName` and `destFileName` arguments can include relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请参阅。To obtain the current working directory, see . 如果你尝试将文件移动多个磁盘卷，并且该文件正在使用中，将文件复制到目标，但它不会删除从源。If you try to move a file across disk volumes and that file is in use, the file is copied to the destination, but it is not deleted from the source. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例将文件移动。The following example moves a file. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法等效于与文件模式设置为构造函数重载，将设置为的访问权限，和共享模式设置为。This method is equivalent to the constructor overload with file mode set to , the access set to , and the share mode set to . 方法打开一个文件，如果其中一个已存在的文件路径，或创建一个新文件，如果不存在。The method opens a file if one already exists for the file path, or creates a new file if one does not exist. 对于现有的文件，它不会不新将文本追加到现有的文本。For an existing file, it does not append the new text to the existing text. 相反，它会用新的字符覆盖现有字符。Instead, it overwrites the existing characters with the new characters. 如果使用较短的字符串 （如"第二个运行"） （例如，"这是 OpenWrite 方法的测试）"覆盖更长的字符串，则文件将包含多种字符串 ("第二个 runtest OpenWrite 方法的")。If you overwrite a longer string (such as "This is a test of the OpenWrite method") with a shorter string (such as "Second run"), the file will contain a mix of the strings ("Second runtest of the OpenWrite method"). `path`参数可以指定相对或绝对路径信息。The `path` parameter may specify relative or absolute path information. 相对路径信息被解释为相对于当前工作目录。Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. 若要获取当前工作目录，请使用方法。To obtain the current working directory, use the method. 返回不支持读取。The returned does not support reading. 若要打开用于读取和写入文件，请使用。To open a file for both reading and writing, use . 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例打开文件以供读取和写入。The following example opens a file for reading and writing. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法打开一个文件，读取该文件，每个行，然后将每个行添加为字符串数组的元素。This method opens a file, reads each line of the file, then adds each line as an element of a string array. 它然后关闭该文件。It then closes the file. 定义为一系列字符后跟回车符 ('\r')，换行符 ('\n') 或由线条后面紧跟一个回车换行符。A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a carriage return ('\r'), a line feed ('\n'), or a carriage return immediately followed by a line feed. 生成的字符串不包含终止回车符和/或换行。The resulting string does not contain the terminating carriage return and/or line feed. 此方法尝试自动检测编码基于存在字节顺序标记的文件。This method attempts to automatically detect the encoding of a file based on the presence of byte order marks. 编码格式 utf-8 和 UTF-32 （big endian 和小字节序） 可以检测到。Encoding formats UTF-8 and UTF-32 (both big-endian and little-endian) can be detected. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将方法来显示文件的内容。The following code example demonstrates the use of the method to display the contents of a file. 在此示例中创建一个文件，如果它尚不存在，并且文本添加到它。In this example a file is created, if it doesn't already exist, and text is added to it. remarks.format: ## Remarks 和方法的行为有所不同，如下所示：当你使用，你可以开始之前，则返回整个集合枚举字符串的集合; 当你使用，必须等待，然后才能访问该数组返回整个字符串数组。The and methods differ as follows: When you use , you can start enumerating the collection of strings before the whole collection is returned; when you use , you must wait for the whole array of strings be returned before you can access the array. 因此，当使用非常大的文件，可能更有效。Therefore, when you are working with very large files, can be more efficient. 可以使用方法来执行以下操作：You can use the method to do the following: - 执行[LINQ to Objects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/73cafe73-37cf-46e7-bfa7-97c7eea7ced9)文件来获取其行的一组筛选的查询。Perform [LINQ to Objects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/73cafe73-37cf-46e7-bfa7-97c7eea7ced9) queries on a file to obtain a filtered set of its lines. - 向文件写入的行返回的集合方法，或将它们追加到现有文件与方法。Write the returned collection of lines to a file with the method, or append them to an existing file with the method. - 创建立即填充的实例的集合的采用集合，这些字符串对于其构造函数，如或。Create an immediately populated instance of a collection that takes an collection of strings for its constructor, such as a or a . 此方法使用编码值。This method uses for the encoding value. ## Examples 下面的示例读取文件以查找包含指定的字符串的行的行。The following example reads the lines of a file to find lines that contain specified strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法会指定文件的内容替换为另一个文件的内容。The method replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file. 它还创建被替换文件的备份。It also creates a backup of the file that was replaced. 如果`sourceFileName`和`destinationFileName`是不同卷上，此方法将引发异常。If the `sourceFileName` and `destinationFileName` are on different volumes, this method will raise an exception. 如果`destinationBackupFileName`是将源文件中的不同卷上删除备份文件。If the `destinationBackupFileName` is on a different volume from the source file, the backup file will be deleted. 传递`null`到`destinationBackupFileName`参数，如果您不想要创建被替换文件的备份。Pass `null` to the `destinationBackupFileName` parameter if you do not want to create a backup of the file being replaced. 如果`destinationBackupFileName`已存在的内容将被覆盖它`destinationFileName`文件。If the `destinationBackupFileName` already exists it will be overwritten with the contents of the `destinationFileName` file. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法文件替换为另一个文件并创建被替换文件的备份。The following code example uses the method to replace a file with another file and create a backup of the replaced file. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法适用于表示非继承的 ACL 列表的文件的访问控制列表 (ACL) 项。The method applies access control list (ACL) entries to a file that represents the noninherited ACL list. > [!CAUTION] > 为 ACL 指定`fileSecurity`参数将替换现有文件 ACL。The ACL specified for the `fileSecurity` parameter replaces the existing ACL for the file. 若要添加新用户的权限，请使用方法以获取现有 ACL，对其进行修改，然后使用以将其应用到的文件。To add permissions for a new user, use the method to obtain the existing ACL, modify it, and then use to apply it back to the file. ACL 描述个人和/或组具有或没有执行到对给定文件的特定操作的权限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或删除访问控制列表条目](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md). 方法仅保持对象创建后修改的对象。The method persists only objects that have been modified after object creation. 如果尚未修改对象，它不会保存到文件。If a object has not been modified, it will not be persisted to a file. 因此，不能检索对象从一个文件，并对另一个文件重新应用相同的对象。Therefore, it is not possible to retrieve a object from one file and reapply the same object to another file. 若要将 ACL 信息从一个文件复制到另一种：To copy ACL information from one file to another: 1. 使用方法来检索源文件中的对象。Use the method to retrieve the object from the source file. 2. 创建一个新目标文件的对象。Create a new object for the destination file. 3. 使用或源方法对象来检索 ACL 信息。Use the or method of the source object to retrieve the ACL information. 4. 使用或方法以将信息复制到目标的步骤 3 中检索对象。Use the or method to copy the information retrieved in step 3 to the destination object. 5. 设置目标对象与目标文件使用方法。Set the destination object to the destination file using the method. 在 NTFS 环境中，并如果用户具有向用户授予上的父文件夹的权限。In NTFS environments, and are granted to the user if the user has rights on the parent folder. 若要拒绝并，拒绝上的父目录。To deny and , deny on the parent directory. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用和方法来添加，然后删除所需的访问控制列表 (ACL) 项从一个文件。The following code example uses the and methods to add and then remove an access control list (ACL) entry from a file. 你必须提供有效的用户或组帐户以运行此示例。You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example.
